alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 4:24PM EDT until September 08 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Hunterdon County in northwestern New Jersey... Central Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 423 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Gardenville, or 22 miles northwest of Trenton, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Doylestown, Byram, Bedminster, Chalfont, Tinicum, New Hope, Dublin, Frenchtown, Milford, Stockton, Ottsville, Sergeantsville, Pipersville, Erwinna, Gardenville, Lumberville, Lambertville, New Britain and Silverdale. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
